feature1.explanation: Both texts use punctuation marks such as commas and apostrophes consistently.

feature2.explanation: Text 1 uses more formal and structured language related to media guidelines, while Text 2 contains informal language with colloquial expressions.

feature3.explanation: Text 1 has a more structured and formal sentence arrangement compared to the informal and fragmented structure of Text 2.

feature4.explanation: Text 1 has a more informational and directive tone, whereas Text 2 has a conversational and critical tone.

feature5.explanation: There are no spelling or typographical errors in either text.

overall.explanation: Considering the differences in lexical and grammatical features, sentence structure, and text/discourse features, along with the similarities in punctuation style and absence of spelling errors, the overall likelihood that the two texts were written by the same author is moderate.
